episodeTitle: When the Kingdom's Rule is Over! The Flag of Conviction Lasts Forever
episodeTitleJapanese: 王国の支配終る時！信念の旗は永遠に
episodeTitleRomaji: Ōkoku no shihai owaru toki! Shinnen no hata wa eien ni
description: Luffy confronts Wapol in a final battle atop Drum Castle. After defeating Wapol and sending him flying from the island, the Drum Kingdom's tyrannical rule ends as Dalton and the villagers witness the fall of their corrupt king.

events.title: Final Confrontation: Luffy vs Wapol
events.description: Inside Drum Castle, Luffy begins the final battle against Wapol. Wapol attempts various tricks and uses his Baku Baku no Mi abilities to defeat Luffy, but Luffy is determined to protect Dr. Hiriluk's flag.
events.significance: Marks the climactic battle of the Drum Island Arc and the end of Wapol's tyrannical rule.

quotes.text: I was beating up the king!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy tells Dalton what he was doing at the castle

events.title: Nami Gets an Expensive Coat
events.description: Nami finds a valuable coat inside Drum Castle and prepares to escape while Kureha is occupied. She paid 28,800 berries for it after bargaining.
events.significance: Shows Nami's continued tendency to acquire valuable items and her practical nature.

events.title: Sanji Recovering from Injury
events.description: Sanji crawls back to Nami, still debilitated by his re-injured back. He realizes she is not actually injured despite his concerns.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's dedication to protecting Nami even while injured, continuing his chivalrous character trait.

events.title: Wapol Attacks Nami
events.description: Wapol attempts to tackle and consume Nami, but receives a powerful kick to the face from Luffy, saving her.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's protective nature toward his crew members and Wapol's ruthless disregard for anyone in his way.

events.title: Nami Hits Luffy for Damaging Her Coat
events.description: After Luffy saves her, Nami conks Luffy over the head for damaging her expensive jacket that cost her 28,800 berries after bargaining.
events.significance: Classic comedic moment showing Nami's priorities and the crew's dynamic even during serious battles.

events.title: Dalton Arrives at Drum Castle via Ropeway
events.description: Dalton, along with Zoro, Usopp, and Vivi, arrives at Drum Castle using the Drum Ropeway gondola. Despite still recovering from injuries and hypothermia, Dalton is determined to witness Wapol's defeat.
events.significance: Marks the arrival of witnesses to Wapol's defeat and sets up the transition to a new government for Drum Kingdom.

events.title: Dalton Recalls Wapol's Tyranny
events.description: On the Drum Ropeway, Dalton recalls how Wapol captured most of Drum's doctors, and his ministers claimed that government did not need to be good to its people.
events.significance: Provides context for the depth of Wapol's corruption and why his defeat is so important to Drum Island's people.

events.title: Royal Drum Crown Seven-Shot Bliking Cannon
events.description: Wapol unveils his ultimate weapon, the Royal Drum Crown Seven-Shot Bliking Cannon, at the top dome of the castle. However, when he tries to fire it at Luffy, it only makes noises and shoots snowbirds that were nesting inside.
events.significance: Shows Wapol's desperation and the deteriorated state of his kingdom's defenses, adding a comedic element to the battle.

events.title: Wapol Uses Bero Cannon
events.description: Wapol opens his mouth wide to eat Luffy, but Luffy's rubber fingers stretch around it. Wapol then turns his tongue into Bero Cannon to shoot Luffy.
events.significance: Demonstrates another application of Wapol's Baku Baku no Mi abilities, showing his Devil Fruit's versatility in combat.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Bow Gun
events.description: Luffy is unharmed by Wapol's Bero Cannon and counters with Gomu Gomu no Bow Gun, firing Wapol upward and getting him stuck in the top of the dome.
events.significance: Introduces a new Gomu Gomu no Mi technique, showing Luffy's creativity in using his rubber powers.

events.title: Luffy Defends Dr. Hiriluk's Flag
events.description: Wapol sees Dr. Hiriluk's flag on a spire of the castle where Luffy replanted it. Luffy tells Wapol not to mess with the flag and stands in front of cannonballs to prevent damage to it.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's respect for others' dreams and convictions, a core theme of One Piece. The flag represents Dr. Hiriluk's medical ideals and will to cure the kingdom.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Wapol with Gomu Gomu no Bazooka
events.description: Ignoring Wapol's pleas, including an offer to make him vice-king, Luffy uses an enhanced Gomu Gomu no Bazooka to launch Wapol far away from Drum Island, ending his tyrannical rule.
events.significance: Concludes the main conflict of the Drum Island Arc. Wapol's defeat liberates the kingdom and allows for the establishment of a new, just government under Dalton.

events.title: End of the Drum Kingdom
events.description: After Wapol is defeated and blown away by Luffy, the people of the kingdom witness the end of the Drum Kingdom's rule. Kureha tells Chopper that the end of the Drum Kingdom has finally come.
events.significance: Marks the end of a tyrannical era and sets the stage for the kingdom's rebirth as the Sakura Kingdom. This is a pivotal moment in Drum Island's history.

events.title: Dalton Recognizes Chopper's Heroism
events.description: Dalton notices Chopper and remembers him from the ambush on Dr. Hiriluk. Realizing Chopper has always been fighting for the kingdom's people, he bows to the reindeer, thanking him and vowing that the kingdom will be reborn.
events.significance: Marks a turning point in how Chopper is perceived by the islanders, though the other villagers still call him a monster. Shows Dalton's wisdom and gratitude.

events.title: Villagers Still Fear Chopper
events.description: Despite Dalton's recognition of Chopper's heroism, the other villagers arrive and identify Chopper as a monster, showing that prejudice against him still exists.
events.significance: Highlights the ongoing struggle Chopper faces with acceptance, which makes his eventual recruitment to the Straw Hats even more meaningful.

events.title: Chopper Tells Kureha About Luffy's Friendship
events.description: In an extended anime-original scene, Chopper tells Kureha that Luffy said he was his friend, showing Chopper's growing bond with the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Sets up Chopper's emotional decision to join the crew in the next episode. Shows how much Luffy's acceptance means to Chopper.

quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.speaker: Dr. Kureha

themes.description: The episode's title emphasizes the importance of standing by one's convictions. Luffy defends Dr. Hiriluk's flag, representing the doctor's ideals and dream of curing the kingdom's heart. This demonstrates that true principles outlast tyrants.
themes.symbolism: Dr. Hiriluk's flag represents unwavering medical ideals and the will to help others, which Luffy protects even in battle.

themes.description: Wapol's defeat marks the end of a corrupt regime that hoarded doctors and oppressed its people. The episode shows how one person's courage can free an entire nation.
themes.symbolism: Wapol being literally sent flying from the island symbolizes the complete removal of tyranny from Drum Island.

themes.description: Dalton recognizes Chopper's heroism and bows in gratitude, though other villagers still fear him. This shows the gradual path toward acceptance that Chopper experiences.
themes.symbolism: Dalton's bow represents respect and recognition of Chopper's true nature beyond his appearance.

themes.description: Luffy refuses Wapol's offer to become vice-king, showing that he values his dream and principles over power or wealth. This reinforces a core One Piece theme.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his core principle of fighting for others' dreams and convictions. Refuses power in favor of his own path.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scene where Nami and Sanji meet up in the castle, adding more interaction between them.
Extended interaction between Dr. Kureha and Chopper outside the castle, including Chopper telling Kureha that Luffy called him a friend.

trivia.fact: Episode 89 had a TV rating of 15.8%, ranking 4th in viewership for that week.
The episode adapts content from manga chapters 150-152, covering the conclusion of Luffy's battle with Wapol.
Wapol's Royal Drum Crown Seven-Shot Bliking Cannon fails comically, only releasing snowbirds instead of firing projectiles.
This episode marks one of the few times Luffy is offered a position of power (vice-king) which he immediately refuses in favor of his dream.
The enhanced version of Gomu Gomu no Bazooka used in this episode is specifically designed for sending heavy opponents flying great distances.
Bin Shimada, Wapol's Japanese voice actor, has voiced over 300 characters across various anime series during his career.
